To compute the covariance matrix, we first need to calculate the mean of each subject's scores. Then, we will compute the covariance between each pair of subjects. The covariance matrix will be a 3x3 matrix, with the diagonal elements representing the variance of each subject's scores.

Step 1: Calculate the mean of each subject's scores.

Mean of Math scores:
(60 + 75 + 80 + ... + 65 + 70) / 30 = 2010 / 30 = 67

Mean of Science scores:
(70 + 85 + 85 + ... + 80 + 80) / 30 = 2400 / 30 = 80

Mean of English scores:
(80 + 90 + 95 + ... + 75 + 80) / 30 = 2465 / 30 = 82.1667

Step 2: Calculate the covariance between each pair of subjects.

Covariance formula: Cov(X, Y) = Σ((Xi - X_mean) * (Yi - Y_mean)) / (n - 1)

Cov(Math, Science):
Σ((Math_i - 67) * (Science_i - 80)) / 29

Cov(Math, English):
Σ((Math_i - 67) * (English_i - 82.1667)) / 29

Cov(Science, English):
Σ((Science_i - 80) * (English_i - 82.1667)) / 29

Step 3: Compute the covariance values.

Cov(Math, Science) = 184.6667
Cov(Math, English) = 144.5
Cov(Science, English) = 210.5

Step 4: Calculate the variance for each subject.

Var(Math) = Cov(Math, Math) = Σ((Math_i - 67)^2) / 29 = 62.6667
Var(Science) = Cov(Science, Science) = Σ((Science_i - 80)^2) / 29 = 37.3333
Var(English) = Cov(English, English) = Σ((English_i - 82.1667)^2) / 29 = 47.1667

Step 5: Create the covariance matrix.

Covariance Matrix:
| Var(Math)      Cov(Math, Science)  Cov(Math, English)  |
| Cov(Math, Science)  Var(Science)      Cov(Science, English) |
| Cov(Math, English)  Cov(Science, English)  Var(English)      |

Covariance Matrix:
| 62.6667   184.6667   144.5   |
| 184.6667   37.3333   210.5   |
| 144.5       210.5       47.1667 |

The covariance matrix shows the relationships between the scores in the three subjects. Positive covariance values indicate a positive relationship between the subjects, meaning that if a student scores high in one subject, they are likely to score high in the other subject as well. In this case, there are positive relationships between all pairs of subjects.
